message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String str = "23 14 this is a random string";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str);
        st.nextToken(); // Skip first integer
        st.nextToken(); // Skip second integer
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            sb.append(st.nextToken());
            if (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
                sb.append(" ");
            }
        }
        System.out.println(sb.toString()); // Output: this is a random string
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we create a StringTokenizer object with the input string. We then call nextToken() twice to skip the first two integers. After that, we use a while loop to append the remaining tokens (words) to a StringBuilder object, adding a space after each word except the last one. Finally, we print the resulting string.
